channel.title: Simba 0.99-rc2 release
channel.description:
I don't usually post on MITB about Simba releases, but I just wanted to let you guys know that I've run my first SRL script on Simba x86_64 Linux using our new interpreter. I'm still working on some limitations in our Linux keyboard implementation, but it's a huge step forward and I wouldn't be surprised if we could run most if not all SRL scripts within a month or two on Linux without wine.
You can download this release from Jenkins (http://moparisthebest.com/jenkins Simba_Stable branch) or from my temporary buildbot. http://l0.lt (Simba-master branch)
Direct links also available: [b]Download (exe only):[/b] [url=http://nala.villavu.com/downloads/master/d3a47812d4aaec9cbf95935fd093549233c466a0/Simba.i386-win32.exe]http://nala.villavu.com/downloads/master/d3a47812d4aaec9cbf95935fd093549233c466a0/Simba.i386-win32.exe[/url] [b]Download (installer): [/b] [url=http://nala.villavu.com/downloads/master/d3a47812d4aaec9cbf95935fd093549233c466a0/SimbaInstaller.i386-win32.exe]http://nala.villavu.com/downloads/master/d3a47812d4aaec9cbf95935fd093549233c466a0/SimbaInstaller.i386-win32.exe[/url]
[i]Note that this Simba will not yet go into the auto updater, because it is a release candidate. It needs testing and we rely on your feedback.[/i]
Changes:
[ul][*] Installer ships with PDF and HTML documentation. [*] [I]New Settings Form[/I]. [*] Portable Simba. (Default, System-wide Simba install will follow later) [*] The non-portable version of Simba now respects user directories on both Windows and Unix (with XDG support). [*] More hash/cipher functions.
[*] Major settings backend rework. [*] Added Version to Simba's UserAgent. [*] Latest and greatest Lape. [*] Support for JPG/PNG in TMufasaBitmap.SaveToFile (and in SaveBitmap) [*] [B]Formatter extension[/B] to nicely format your scripts. [*] Examples/ directory. [*] SendKeys now also has [b]keymodwait[/b] [*] [b]onScriptOpen[/b] and [b]onScriptStart[/b] hooks for extensions.[/ul]
Experimental changes:
[ul][*] Crash logger. When something goes wrong, Simba will attempt to write a log to a file. You can then choose to keep running Simba or terminate it. ([i]I feel this is the most experimental feature[/i]) [*] Initial support for loading a bitmap from clipboard in the bitmap convertor.[/ul]
Fixes:
[ul][*] Fixed TFontStyle enum. [*] DTM Editor fix for mouse hovering. [*] Some memory clean ups. [*] FindFile fix. [*] Read Only mode is no longer allowed on unsaved scripts. [*] Decreased default verbosity. [*] Minor fix to CTS 3 modifiers. [*] GetColors fix for Linux. [*] Allow mouse movement outside the client on Linux [*] Including files multiple times will not mess with the function list.[/ul]

item.title: Simba 0.99-rc2 release
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

can’t wait till the Linux supported version is released

Read full topic

item.title: Simba 0.99-rc2 release
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

This is exciting, and I’ll be sure to fix the SMART build soon.

Read full topic

item.title: Simba 0.99-rc2 release
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

Mopar, with SMART 7.0 (I don’t think you can get it from jenkins atm, BenLand100 changed the Makefile), Simba can use SMARTs Input/Image stuff with Lape, since it’s all using EIOS.

If you use the lape branch of SRL 5, you should be able to runs scripts that don’t use forms or other silly classes on Linux x64, Linux x86, etc. Right now you need a very recent Simba, but I think all the work will be ready in Simba 0.99.0

Details on the SMART stuff: http://villavu.com/forum/showthread.php?p=968932#post968932

Read full topic

item.title: Simba 0.99-rc2 release
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Wizzup?:

I wouldn’t be surprised if we could run most if not all SRL scripts within a month or two on Linux without wine.

Oh man, that is exciting, I’ve been waiting for that since the first time I heard about Simba. Running it under wine works passably, but it’s too much of a pain to set up to be practical.

Keep us informed here of the progress.

Read full topic

item.title: Simba 0.99-rc2 release
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

I don’t usually post on MITB about Simba releases, but I just wanted to let you guys know that I’ve run my first SRL script on Simba x86_64 Linux using our new interpreter.
I’m still working on some limitations in our Linux keyboard implementation, but it’s a huge step forward and I wouldn’t be surprised if we could run most if not all SRL scripts within a month or two on Linux without wine.

You can download this release from Jenkins (http://moparisthebest.com/jenkins Simba_Stable branch) or from my temporary buildbot. http://l0.lt (Simba-master branch)

Direct links also available:
Download (exe only): http://nala.villavu.com/downloads/master/d3a47812d4aaec9cbf95935fd093549233c466a0/Simba.i386-win32.exe
Download (installer): http://nala.villavu.com/downloads/master/d3a47812d4aaec9cbf95935fd093549233c466a0/SimbaInstaller.i386-win32.exe

Note that this Simba will not yet go into the auto updater, because it is a release candidate. It needs testing and we rely on your feedback.

Changes:

[ul][] Installer ships with PDF and HTML documentation.
[] New Settings Form.
[] Portable Simba. (Default, System-wide Simba install will follow later)
[] The non-portable version of Simba now respects user directories on both Windows and Unix (with XDG support).
[*] More hash/cipher functions.

[] Major settings backend rework.
[] Added Version to Simba’s UserAgent.
[] Latest and greatest Lape.
[] Support for JPG/PNG in TMufasaBitmap.SaveToFile (and in SaveBitmap)
[] Formatter extension to nicely format your scripts.
[] Examples/ directory.
[] SendKeys now also has keymodwait
[] onScriptOpen and onScriptStart hooks for extensions.[/ul]

Experimental changes:

[ul][] Crash logger. When something goes wrong, Simba will attempt to write a log to a file. You can then choose to keep running Simba or terminate it. (I feel this is the most experimental feature)
[] Initial support for loading a bitmap from clipboard in the bitmap convertor.[/ul]

Fixes:

[ul][] Fixed TFontStyle enum.
[] DTM Editor fix for mouse hovering.
[] Some memory clean ups.
[] FindFile fix.
[] Read Only mode is no longer allowed on unsaved scripts.
[] Decreased default verbosity.
[] Minor fix to CTS 3 modifiers.
[] GetColors fix for Linux.
[] Allow mouse movement outside the client on Linux
[] Including files multiple times will not mess with the function list.[/ul]

Read full topic
